abstracts.cdata!:
The Provincial Grid Integration
            Project's outcome is rated as satisfactory. The most
            important lessons drawn from the experience in implementing
            the project are: 1) Borrower's involvement is key for
            an effective collaboration between Borrower and implementing
            agency. The Bank can play an important role to promote this
            collaboration by ensuring Borrower's representation
            during Bank's mission, project visits, and major
            project events. 2) When an ongoing operation is used to
            provide supplemental financing for technical studies
            associated to potential future operations, this supplemental
            financing should be assigned only after ensuring that
            sufficient funds are available for ongoing activities under
            the project. 3) When there is more than one implementing
            agency involved, individual project agreements between each
            implementing agency and the Bank should be provided. This
            will improve efficiency in the management and accounting of
            loan funds and increase accountability from each
            implementing agency.

18154428.trustfund:
TF022865-ALTERNATIVE ENERGY POLICY &
            PROJECT DEV.,TF023485-USDOE-ALTERNATIVE ENERGY ACTIVITIES

abstracts.cdata!:
The project includes the following
            components: (a) a provincial electrification component,
            which includes the construction of several overhead
            river-crossing lines to interconnect disaggregated local
            networks with the Thai grid and extension of networks in six
            provinces of the country's central and southern
            regions; (b) a system efficiency component, which includes
            action programs for the Electricite du Laos (EdL) to reduce
            system losses, improve billing and collections, and reduce
            arrears from government agencies; and equipment and
            materials to strengthen EdL's operation and maintenance
            services, particularly at its provincial subsidiaries; (c)
            an institutional development component that includes
            equipment, materials and services, and needed technical
            assistance for upgrading the skills of EdL's staff and
            its training facilities; and (d) a future project
            development component that includes a feasibility study for
            the installation of additional capacity and the Nam Ngum
            hydro station.

The project includes the following
            components: (a) a provincial electrification component,
            which includes the construction of several overhead
            river-crossing lines to interconnect disaggregated local
            networks with the Thai grid and extension of networks in six
            provinces of the country's central and southern
            regions; (b) a system efficiency component, which includes
            action programs for the Electricite du Laos (EdL) to reduce
            system losses, improve billing and collections, and reduce
            arrears from government agencies; and equipment and
            materials to strengthen EdL's operation and maintenance
            services, particularly at its provincial subsidiaries; (c)
            an institutional development component that includes
            equipment, materials and services, and needed technical
            assistance for upgrading the skills of EdL's staff and
            its training facilities; and (d) a future project
            development component that includes a feasibility study for
            the installation of additional capacity and the Nam Ngum
            hydro station.
